CatDescriptText: Mr. James Betts, chipper, South Side and Mr. Gene Allen, student, Indiana, Pa., were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 2, 1962, pg. 13 with question: "What's the ideal way to spend a summer vacation?" Mr. Betts' answer reads: Travels the thing - visiting relatives.  For me, it's out of the question to think of traveling abroad, but I'd like to do it sometime."  Mr. Allen's answer reads: "You should do something worthwhile.  I'd like to go to Europe, but since I'll be at college next fall, I won't be able to afford it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James Betts wearing fedora, eyeglasses, and moustache, standing on sidewalk in front of car and building; Portrait of Gene Allen wearing dark necktie and tweed suit jacket, standing on sidewalk in front of street with automobiles and buildings with signs
